quizzes.question: Which function is used to access files?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Opening Files[/h1]

You can use Python to read and write the contents of [b]files[/b].
Text files are the easiest to manipulate. Before a file can be edited, it must be opened, using the [b]open [/b]function. [code format="py"]myfile = [b]open[/b]("filename.txt")[/code]
[note]The argument of the [b]open [/b]function is the [b]path [/b]to the file. If the file is in the same directory as the program, you can specify only its name.[/note]

quizzes.question:
Fill in the blanks to open a file called "test.bin" in binary read mode.
[!raw!]
file = open({0}, {1})
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Opening Files[/h1]

You can specify the [b]mode[/b] used to open a file by applying a second argument to the [b]open [/b]function.
Sending "r" means open in read mode, which is the default. 
Sending "w" means write mode, for rewriting the contents of a file.
Sending "a" means append mode, for adding new content to the end of the file.

Adding "b" to a mode opens it in [b]binary [/b]mode, which is used for non-text files (such as image and sound files).
[b]For example:[/b] [code format="py"]# write mode
open("filename.txt", [b]"w"[/b])

# read mode
open("filename.txt", [b]"r"[/b])
open("filename.txt")

# binary write mode
open("filename.txt", [b]"wb"[/b])[/code]

quizzes.question: How would you close a file stored in a variable "text_file"?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Opening Files[/h1]

Once a file has been opened and used, you should close it.
This is done with the [b]close [/b]method of the file object. [code format="py"]file = open("filename.txt", "w")
# do stuff to the file
file.[b]close[/b]()[/code]
[note]We will read/write content to files in the upcoming lessons.[/note]
